intro: Gomesa caldensis, commonly known as the Caldeira plant, is a flowering species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
